history.name: BusinessAnalyst
history.prompt: As a Senior Business Analyst who has deep domain knowledge in multiple domains and vast experience in creating enterprise applications. Understand the given context about the application and suggest the requirement specifications, functional requirements and user stories.

messages.content:
We have a legacy QR code generator application which is designed using Win-Forms. We would like to modernise the application, and leverage latest technologies so that to give a great experience for the end users.

High-level functionalities of the application are:

1. User can provide a URL of the website
2. Generate button will create a QR code in the backend and display an image in QR code format
3. The QR code image also has embedded logo of the website generated
4. User can also change the backgroud and color of the logo
5. User has a provision to save the image to his machine

Our architect team has desided to use React JS for front-end & ExpressJS(Node) for backend of the application. 

Suggest user stories for migrating this existing functionality to a new technology stack. Provide these details:

User Story ID:
User Story Description:
Acceptance Criteria:

Map these user stories to some high level Epic, and we want to leverage the output to store in JIRA.

Please create the content.

settings.prompt: As a Senior Business Analyst who has deep domain knowledge in multiple domains and vast experience in creating enterprise applications. Understand the given context about the application and suggest the requirement specifications, functional requirements and user stories.

messages.content:
Epic: Modernization of QR Code Generator Application

User Story ID: QR-01
User Story Description: As a user, I want to be able to input a URL of a website into the application.
Acceptance Criteria: 
- The application should have an input field to accept a URL.
- The application should validate the URL for correctness.

User Story ID: QR-02
User Story Description: As a user, I want to generate a QR code from the provided URL.
Acceptance Criteria: 
- The application should have a 'Generate' button.
- On clicking the 'Generate' button, the application should create a QR code corresponding to the input URL.

User Story ID: QR-03
User Story Description: As a user, I want the generated QR code to have an embedded logo of the website.
Acceptance Criteria: 
- The application should fetch the logo of the website from the provided URL.
- The generated QR code should have the website's logo embedded in it.

User Story ID: QR-04
User Story Description: As a user, I want to be able to change the background and color of the logo in the QR code.
Acceptance Criteria: 
- The application should provide options to change the background and color of the logo.
- The changes should be reflected in the QR code immediately.

User Story ID: QR-05
User Story Description: As a user, I want to save the generated QR code image to my machine.
Acceptance Criteria: 
- The application should provide an option to save the QR code image.
- On selecting the 'Save' option, the QR code image should be saved to the user's machine.

These user stories can be mapped to the high-level Epic 'Modernization of QR Code Generator Application' and can be stored in JIRA for tracking and management.

settings.prompt: As a Senior Business Analyst who has deep domain knowledge in multiple domains and vast experience in creating enterprise applications. Understand the given context about the application and suggest the requirement specifications, functional requirements and user stories.

messages.content: Good, can you generate all the user stories in a tabular format for a quick review ?

settings.prompt: As a Senior Business Analyst who has deep domain knowledge in multiple domains and vast experience in creating enterprise applications. Understand the given context about the application and suggest the requirement specifications, functional requirements and user stories.

messages.content:
Sure, here are the user stories in a tabular format:

| User Story ID | User Story Description | Acceptance Criteria |
| --- | --- | --- |
| QR-01 | As a user, I want to be able to input a URL of a website into the application. | The application should have an input field to accept a URL. The application should validate the URL for correctness. |
| QR-02 | As a user, I want to generate a QR code from the provided URL. | The application should have a 'Generate' button. On clicking the 'Generate' button, the application should create a QR code corresponding to the input URL. |
| QR-03 | As a user, I want the generated QR code to have an embedded logo of the website. | The application should fetch the logo of the website from the provided URL. The generated QR code should have the website's logo embedded in it. |
| QR-04 | As a user, I want to be able to change the background and color of the logo in the QR code. | The application should provide options to change the background and color of the logo. The changes should be reflected in the QR code immediately. |
| QR-05 | As a user, I want to save the generated QR code image to my machine. | The application should provide an option to save the QR code image. On selecting the 'Save' option, the QR code image should be saved to the user's machine. |

settings.prompt: As a Senior Business Analyst who has deep domain knowledge in multiple domains and vast experience in creating enterprise applications. Understand the given context about the application and suggest the requirement specifications, functional requirements and user stories.

messages.content: We would also like to have a functionality to download and share the generated QR image with others

settings.prompt: As a Senior Business Analyst who has deep domain knowledge in multiple domains and vast experience in creating enterprise applications. Understand the given context about the application and suggest the requirement specifications, functional requirements and user stories.

messages.content:
Sure, here are the additional user stories for the new functionalities:

User Story ID: QR-06
User Story Description: As a user, I want to download the generated QR code image.
Acceptance Criteria: 
- The application should provide an option to download the QR code image.
- On selecting the 'Download' option, the QR code image should be downloaded to the user's machine.

User Story ID: QR-07
User Story Description: As a user, I want to share the generated QR code image with others.
Acceptance Criteria: 
- The application should provide an option to share the QR code image.
- On selecting the 'Share' option, the user should be able to share the QR code image through various platforms (email, social media, etc.).

Adding these to the table:

| User Story ID | User Story Description | Acceptance Criteria |
| --- | --- | --- |
| QR-06 | As a user, I want to download the generated QR code image. | The application should provide an option to download the QR code image. On selecting the 'Download' option, the QR code image should be downloaded to the user's machine. |
| QR-07 | As a user, I want to share the generated QR code image with others. | The application should provide an option to share the QR code image. On selecting the 'Share' option, the user should be able to share the QR code image through various platforms (email, social media, etc.). |

settings.prompt: As a Senior Business Analyst who has deep domain knowledge in multiple domains and vast experience in creating enterprise applications. Understand the given context about the application and suggest the requirement specifications, functional requirements and user stories.

messages.content:
Add the below enhancements for this application:
- non-functional requirements
- security requirements
- usability requirements

settings.prompt: As a Senior Business Analyst who has deep domain knowledge in multiple domains and vast experience in creating enterprise applications. Understand the given context about the application and suggest the requirement specifications, functional requirements and user stories.

messages.content:
Sure, here are the non-functional, security, and usability requirements:

Non-Functional Requirements:

NFR-01: The application should be able to handle multiple requests concurrently.
NFR-02: The application should have a response time of less than 2 seconds.
NFR-03: The application should be available 99.9% of the time.

Security Requirements:

SR-01: The application should use secure protocols (HTTPS) for communication.
SR-02: The application should not store any personal data of the user.
SR-03: The application should have protection against common web attacks (XSS, SQL Injection, etc.).

Usability Requirements:

UR-01: The application should be user-friendly and intuitive.
UR-02: The application should provide clear error messages.
UR-03: The application should be accessible on multiple devices (desktop, mobile, tablet).

Adding these to the table:

| Requirement ID | Requirement Description |
| --- | --- |
| NFR-01 | The application should be able to handle multiple requests concurrently. |
| NFR-02 | The application should have a response time of less than 2 seconds. |
| NFR-03 | The application should be available 99.9% of the time. |
| SR-01 | The application should use secure protocols (HTTPS) for communication. |
| SR-02 | The application should not store any personal data of the user. |
| SR-03 | The application should have protection against common web attacks (XSS, SQL Injection, etc.). |
| UR-01 | The application should be user-friendly and intuitive. |
| UR-02 | The application should provide clear error messages. |
| UR-03 | The application should be accessible on multiple devices (desktop, mobile, tablet). |

settings.prompt: As a Senior Business Analyst who has deep domain knowledge in multiple domains and vast experience in creating enterprise applications. Understand the given context about the application and suggest the requirement specifications, functional requirements and user stories.

messages.content: Perfect, summarise all these requirements in a single table - by adding a Priority column for implementation. As part of the migration, MVP phase we won't be able to complete all these requirements

settings.prompt: As a Senior Business Analyst who has deep domain knowledge in multiple domains and vast experience in creating enterprise applications. Understand the given context about the application and suggest the requirement specifications, functional requirements and user stories.

messages.content:
Sure, here are all the requirements in a single table with a priority column:

| Requirement ID | Requirement Description | Priority |
| --- | --- | --- |
| QR-01 | As a user, I want to be able to input a URL of a website into the application. | High |
| QR-02 | As a user, I want to generate a QR code from the provided URL. | High |
| QR-03 | As a user, I want the generated QR code to have an embedded logo of the website. | High |
| QR-04 | As a user, I want to be able to change the background and color of the logo in the QR code. | Medium |
| QR-05 | As a user, I want to save the generated QR code image to my machine. | High |
| QR-06 | As a user, I want to download the generated QR code image. | Medium |
| QR-07 | As a user, I want to share the generated QR code image with others. | Medium |
| NFR-01 | The application should be able to handle multiple requests concurrently. | High |
| NFR-02 | The application should have a response time of less than 2 seconds. | High |
| NFR-03 | The application should be available 99.9% of the time. | High |
| SR-01 | The application should use secure protocols (HTTPS) for communication. | High |
| SR-02 | The application should not store any personal data of the user. | High |
| SR-03 | The application should have protection against common web attacks (XSS, SQL Injection, etc.). | High |
| UR-01 | The application should be user-friendly and intuitive. | High |
| UR-02 | The application should provide clear error messages. | Medium |
| UR-03 | The application should be accessible on multiple devices (desktop, mobile, tablet). | Medium |

The priority has been set based on the importance of the requirement for the MVP phase. High priority requirements are crucial for the application to function properly and provide value to the users. Medium priority requirements can be implemented in the next phase.
